snippet: On the eve of a secession referendum in Crimea, Russian forces took a natural gas terminal while Western officials prepared sanctions for Moscow.
abstract: Tensions mount in Ukraine on the eve of a secession referendum in Crimea as helicopter-borne Russian forces make a provocative incursion just beyond peninsula's regional border to seize a natural gas terminal; American and European officials are preparing sanctions to impose on Russia.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN, PETER BAKER and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn reported from Simferopol, Ukraine; Peter Baker from Washington; and Andrew E. Kramer from Kiev, Ukraine. Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations, Steven Lee Myers from Moscow, Noah Sneider from Simferopol and Scott Shane from Washington.

lead_paragraph: On the eve of a secession referendum in Crimea, Russian forces took a natural gas terminal while Western officials prepared sanctions for Moscow.

headline.main: Russia Seizes Gas Plant Near Crimea Border, Ukraine Says
headline.print_headline: Kiev Says Russia Seized Gas Plant Close to Crimea
